alert.note: Alert for Tuscaloosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 5:11PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Tuscaloosa County through 600 PM CDT... At 511 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Tuscaloosa Regional Airport, or near Northport, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Tuscaloosa, Northport, Holt, Brookwood, Coaling, Coker, McFarland Mall, Lake Lurleen State Park, Shelton State Community College, Tuscaloosa Amphitheater, Bryant Denny Stadium, Tuscaloosa Regional Airport, Lake Wildwood, University Mall, Deerlick Creek Campgrounds, Lake Tuscaloosa, Englewood, Cottondale, Little Sandy and Flatwoods. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
